answers.answer: Hello.You will have to consider either diabetic neuropathy or circulation problems in the lower limb.Does she have her blood sugar in the normal range? Diabetes can give rise to peripheral neuropathy, leading to symptoms such as tingling, numbness, burning sensation and pain in the fingers, toes and subsequently other parts of the body.Regards

question: My mother is 67, weight more than 65 KGs, takes a walk every evening for a mile.Recently she has been compaining of both her legs getting numb when she stands for some time, or when she is lying on the bed.When she moves the legs a little, then the numbness goes, but ot comes back quite frequently,which is disturbing her a lot.She has no other problem,except that she gets tired,when she does any physical activity,but otherwise she is active socially as well contributes will in household chores of the family.
title: Old age mother,both legs get numb,frequently while standing and lying on the bed
